intro: Bussea occidentalis, commonly known as the Western bussea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant features finely divided, aromatic leaves and small white to greenish flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
